name: The Seafood Restaurant Accommodation

reviews.title: A tad disappointing
reviews.text: A must visit on a trip to Padstow, we excitedly dined on a very busy Tuesday evening. The restaurant and ambience are lovely but the service is not great. We waited 25 mins for the waitress to even take our drinks order. After a delicious starter our mains arrived, mine rubbery and my husband's cold (he had to send it back to the kitchen to be re-heated), nevertheless our son's steak and chips was the best he had ever tasted (apparently). The wine list is very reasonably priced, unlike the main menu, however the maitre d, a consummate professional, refunded the cost of my husband's meal without question (after some confusion). However we left without eating dessert and feeling a tad disappointed. We had a much more enjoyable meal in the Harbour Inn round the corner the evening before at a fraction of the cost.

Pricey but worth it
reviews.text: We had a lovely night at The Seafood Restaurant last week. Unfortunately we had to be asked to moved as a lare group of people were next to us and were very noisy - singing and generally making a nusiance of themeselves. Non the less, we were moved promptley.

reviews.title: Overpriced but a lovely weekend nonetheless
reviews.text: The service was first class, and we really enjoyed the atmosphere. Onto the food - unless you are having the Fruit de Mer (which is a most magnificent spectacular), I think it's a little over priced. £33 for a piece of Dover Sole (not so much as a salad garnish to accompany) is in my opinion outrageous.

reviews.title: Disappointed & Very Expensive
reviews.text: I don't know whether we visited on the wrong night but I will be honest I was disappointed. After really looking forward to visiting I came away feeling that it was very expensive for what we got. We are used to paying a lot of money for restaurants (The Ivy/Simpsons) but we came away begrudging the £210 we paid. Service was ok we had to ask for a drink after waiting 20 mins in the conservatory and the food was average. Really gutted as it seems other people had a better meal/experience than us.
If you're staying in the Padstow area, I can wholeheartedly recommend the Seafood Restaurant.
reviews.title: Sun, sand and a big bucket of seafood!

reviews.text: Yes, it's not the cheapest place in town, but you're right on the harbour (well, just behind the carpark), 2 minutes round the corner from the winding back lanes full of great places to eat and drink, and finally, you're pretty much on the camel trail, to use the free bikes to ride off some of the amazing breakfasts they serve... The Bircher muesli is just awesome (and I'm not normally a twigs and nuts kind of person).

reviews.title: Delicious lunch did not disappoint

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So we decided to try for Padstow and via internet on our phones (not so easy in Cornwall where the signal is irregular) we booked a hotel and then endured the amazing feat of finding a car parking place and more impressively manouvering into a space. Having exhausted ourselves we staggered along the front past the Rick Stein empire of shops, fish and chips, deli, bookshop etc etc and found ourself outside his restaurant at about 2pm. The managed to fit us in and we had a truly delicious set meal and after wine etc managed to keep the price down to just £116. Superb value. Everything was just perfect, portions are big and my sea bass (my third in a few days) was the most magnificent I had tasted ever - for flavour and texture! Add in those amazing chunky chips and one is in fish heaven.
